column4: are the special effects enabled?  Is the sound choppy to, or just the picture
seems just the video.
try shutting off special effects like this:
System -> Preferences -> Appearance, the the last tab and select no special effects
Dont you think a 6800 with 256 dedicate ram is enough to handle all that?
I don't know, I think those special effects just have problems with video, and some games
I'm working on a 64bit with 1.5GB of ram and disabled them
it isn't a hardware issue, it is a conflict of software
I think that is. :)
I'm about to wipe windows ( i'm running Ubuntu with Wubi ) so I was just curious.
will i'm going to give it a shot right now.  Thanks for the input.  I appreciate it.
no prob. I love the special effects, and they have come a long way, but they haven't arrived yet. :)
They dont seem to have arrived in Vista yet either, so it's all good.
ha ha, I think they are even more advanced in the Linux world, just some video and gaming issues. :)
well i'm off to format.  I'm even going to try putting XP in a VirtualBox VM.
did that work?
I'm typing to you in windows right now, so I can't say.  After I install Ubuntu, I'll give it a shot.
ahh, ok, that is usually one of the problems that I have run into, hope it helps.  After the video you can re-enable the effects. :)
see ya.

no prob.
